trans-unit.source: Specifies the order of XML Digital Signature and XML Encryption operations when both are performed on the same document.

The <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.XmlDecryptionTransform> class provides a transform that determines the order of XML Digital Signature and XML Encryption operations when both are performed on the same document.
Use the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.XmlDecryptionTransform> class whenever you need to perform XML encryption and apply an XML digital signature to the same XML document.

You must pass an <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.EncryptedXml> object to the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.XmlDecryptionTransform.EncryptedXml%2A> property that contains the necessary key information to decrypt the document.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.XmlDecryptionTransform"></xref> class.
Adds a Uniform Resource Identifier (URI) to exclude from processing.
A Uniform Resource Identifier (URI) to exclude from processing
The uri parameter is `null`.
Gets or sets an <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.EncryptedXml"></xref> object that contains information about the keys necessary to decrypt an XML document.

You must pass an <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.EncryptedXml> object to the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.XmlDecryptionTransform.EncryptedXml%2A> property that contains the necessary key information to decrypt the document.
An <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.EncryptedXml"></xref> object that contains information about the keys necessary to decrypt an XML document.

Returns an XML representation of the parameters of an <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.XmlDecryptionTransform"></xref> object that are suitable to be included as subelements of an XMLDSIG `<Transform>` element.

A list of the XML nodes that represent the transform-specific content needed to describe the current <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.XmlDecryptionTransform"></xref> object in an XMLDSIG `<Transform>` element.
Returns the output of the current <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.XmlDsigEnvelopedSignatureTransform"></xref> object.
The output of the current <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.XmlDsigEnvelopedSignatureTransform"></xref> object.
A decryption key could not be found.
Returns the output of the current <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.XmlDsigEnvelopedSignatureTransform"></xref> object.
The type of the output to return.
<xref href="System.Xml.XmlNodeList"></xref> is the only valid type for this parameter.
The output of the current <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.XmlDsigEnvelopedSignatureTransform"></xref> object.
The type parameter is not an object.

Gets an array of types that are valid inputs to the <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.XmlDecryptionTransform.LoadInput(System.Object)"></xref> method of the current <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.XmlDecryptionTransform"></xref> object.

The array returned by the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.XmlDecryptionTransform.InputTypes%2A> property must contain at least one element because every <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.XmlDecryptionTransform> object must accept at least one type as valid input.

An <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.XmlDecryptionTransform> object typically accepts one or more of the following types as input: <xref:System.IO.Stream>, <xref:System.Xml.XmlDocument>, or <xref:System.Xml.XmlNodeList>.

An array of valid input types for the current <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.XmlDecryptionTransform"></xref> object; you can pass only objects of one of these types to the <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.XmlDecryptionTransform.LoadInput(System.Object)"></xref> method of the current <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.XmlDecryptionTransform"></xref> object.
Determines whether the ID attribute of an <xref href="System.Xml.XmlElement"></xref> object matches a specified value.
An object with an ID attribute to compare with idValue.
The value to compare with the ID attribute of inputElement.
`true` if the ID attribute of the inputElement parameter matches the idValue parameter; otherwise, `false`.

Parses the specified <xref href="System.Xml.XmlNodeList"></xref> object as transform-specific content of a `<Transform>` element and configures the internal state of the current <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.XmlDecryptionTransform"></xref> object to match the `<Transform>` element.
This method is used to process subelements of a `<Transform>` element.
An <xref href="System.Xml.XmlNodeList"></xref> object that specifies transform-specific content for the current <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.XmlDecryptionTransform"></xref> object.
The nodeList parameter is `null`.
-or-
The Uniform Resource Identifier (URI) value of an object in nodeList was not found.
-or-
The length of the URI value of an object in nodeList is 0.
-or-
The first character of the URI value of an object in nodeList is not '#'.
When overridden in a derived class, loads the specified input into the current <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.XmlDecryptionTransform"></xref> object.
The type of the input object must be one of the types in the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.XmlDecryptionTransform.InputTypes%2A> property.
The input to load into the current <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.XmlDecryptionTransform"></xref> object.
The obj parameter is `null`.

Gets an array of types that are possible outputs from the <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.XmlDecryptionTransform.GetOutput"></xref> methods of the current <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.XmlDecryptionTransform"></xref> object.

The array returned by the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.XmlDecryptionTransform.OutputTypes%2A> property must contain at least one element because every transform must generate at least one type as output.

An array of valid output types for the current <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.XmlDecryptionTransform"></xref> object; only objects of one of these types are returned from the <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.XmlDecryptionTransform.GetOutput"></xref> methods of the current <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.XmlDecryptionTransform"></xref> object.
